abstract: David Chao — a general partner at DCM, a major Renren shareholder — talks about why his firm is holding its stake in the Facebook of China, the long-term value of the social networking site and the recent accounting questions at the company.
snippet: David Chao — a general partner at DCM, a major Renren shareholder — talks about why his firm is holding its stake in the Facebook of China, the long-term value of the social networking site and the recent accounting questions at the company.
lead_paragraph: Many of Renren’s investors profited handsomely from the company’s initial public offering, when shares priced at $14 on Wednesday. But a venture capital firm, DCM, which owns 7.5 percent of the Chinese social networking site, is holding on to its stake.
